title: Tensor Warm-Up
story: Welcome to Deep Learning! Before we build neural networks, we need to understand tensors - the fundamental data structure of deep learning. Tensors are just multi-dimensional arrays: vectors (1D), matrices (2D), and higher-dimensional arrays (3D+). Let's create your first tensors!
instructions: Import numpy as np. Create three tensors: `vector` with shape (3,) containing [1., 2., 3.], `matrix` with shape (2, 3) containing [[1., 2., 3.], [4., 5., 6.]], and `tensor3d` with shape (2, 2, 2) containing [[[1., 2.], [3., 4.]], [[5., 6.], [7., 8.]]]. Print all three and their shapes.
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np
vector = np.array([1., 2., 3.])
matrix = np.array([[1., 2., 3.], [4., 5., 6.]])
tensor3d = np.array([[[1., 2.], [3., 4.]], [[5., 6.], [7., 8.]]])
print(vector)
print(vector.shape)
print(matrix)
print(matrix.shape)
print(tensor3d)
print(tensor3d.shape)

tests.description: NumPy should be imported as np

hints.text: Use np.array() to create tensors. Check shapes with .shape attribute
